revised_title: Protein Engineering and Its Applications in Medicine and Industry
tldr: This article discusses the design, construction, and properties of novel protein molecules, focusing on enzyme mechanisms and their applications in medicine and industry. The authors highlight the potential of protein engineering in creating enzymes for specific catalytic functions, genetically engineered monoclonal antibodies, and the use of immobilized enzymes in chemical synthesis. They also touch upon the economic value of genetically engineered enzymes and their impact on clinical biochemistry.
